the scene is anchored right and left by two bright stars mu and eta geminorum at the foot of the celestial twin while the jellyfish nebula is the brighter arcing ridge of emission with dangling tentacles below and right of center
in fact the cosmic jellyfish is part of bubble shaped supernova remnant ic 443 the expanding debris cloud from a massive star that exploded
light from the explosion first reached planet earth over 30 000 years ago
like its cousin in astrophysical waters the crab nebula supernova remnant the jellyfish nebula is known to harbor a neutron star the remnant of the collapsed stellar core
an emission nebula cataloged as sharpless 249 fills the field at the upper left
the jellyfish nebula is about 5 000 light years away
at that distance this narrowband composite image would be about 300 light years across
